question: Will Trump send Tomahawk to Ukraine by October 31?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if the Trump administration or the U.S. government announces that it is sending, has sent, or will send Tomahawk cruise missiles to Ukraine by October 31, 2025, at 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.”

A qualifying statement within the specified timeframe will suffice regardless of when the missiles are sent.

For the purposes of this market, official policy announcements from the Trump administration or the U.S. government will qualify. Informal statements, leaks, or speculative remarks will not be sufficient.

The primary resolution sources for this market will be official information from the Trump administration, the U.S. government, or the government of Ukraine. A consensus of credible reporting may also be used if no direct official statement is available.

question: Will Vegas Matt be profitable: Week of October 19
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vegas Matt’s video descriptions on YouTube show a net profit for the week ending on the specified Sunday. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No".

The market will resolve each Monday, based on all eligible full-length YouTube videos posted from Monday through Sunday 11:59 PM ET. YouTube Shorts, live streams, and clips will not be considered.

Resolution is based solely on statistics in the video descriptions, which list his running balance and results from the previous video. If the description and video content conflict, the description prevails.

Because each description reports the balance from the prior video, the final video only provides the balance for the preceding day, and its content does not contribute to that week’s result.

If no qualifying video is posted during the covered period (from Monday through Sunday ET), the market will resolve to "No".

This market's primary resolution source will be the video descriptions on Vegas Matt’s official YouTube account (https://www.youtube.com/@VegasMatt/videos).

question: Israel strikes Gaza by October 17?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Israel initiates a drone, missile, or air strike on Gaza soil by October 17, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a qualifying "strike" is defined as the use of aerial bombs, drones or missiles (including cruise or ballistic missiles) launched by Israeli military forces that impact Gaza ground territory.

A strike on any area within the terrestrial territory of the Gaza Strip counts, including buffer zones.

Missiles or drones which are intercepted and surface-to-air missile strikes will not be sufficient for a "Yes" resolution regardless of whether they land on Gaza territory or cause damage.

Actions such as artillery fire, small arms fire, FPV or ATGM strikes, ground incursions, naval shelling, cyberattacks, or other operations conducted by Israeli ground operatives will not qualify.

The resolution source will be credible video or photo evidence, or reporting from The New York Times, the Associated Press, Bloomberg News, Reuters, Axios, Politico, Semafor, The Washington Post, The Wall Street Journal, ABC, CBS, CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, NBC, BBC, Der Spiegel, DW, Le Monde, Sky News, Al Jazeera, The Kyiv Independent and The Guardian may also be used.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 16, 8PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the BTC/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Will anyone say "New York" or "New Yorker" 30+ times during 1st NYC mayoral debate on October 16?
description:
The first NYC mayoral debate is scheduled to take place on October 16, 2025, 7 PM ET. More here: https://www.nycvotes.org/whats-on-the-ballot/2025-nyc-candidate-debates/

This market will resolve to "Yes" if any candidate says the listed term during his appearance at this event. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No."

Any usage of the term, regardless of context, will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the term will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Instances where the term is used in a compound word will count regardless of context (e.g., "joyful" is not a compound word for "joy"; however, "killjoy" is a compounding of the words "kill" and "joy").

If this market requires a specified number of mentions of a person’s first or last name, a full-name mention will count as one mention (e.g., if a market is about “Joe / Biden 5+ times,” a mention of “Joe Biden” will count once).

This market is explicitly about the named debate. Speeches, events, or comments that occur outside of this event will not qualify toward this market's resolution. If the event contains a Q&A, it will count toward the resolution of this market.

If the event has not aired in its entirety by October 16, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on what has aired up to that point. If no appearance is aired by this time, or if it is otherwise definitively cancelled, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the audio/video of the listed event.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 14, 11:45PM-12:00AM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the Bitcoin price at the end of the time range specified in the title is greater than or equal to the price at the beginning of that range. Otherwise, it will resolve to "Down".
The resolution source for this market is information from Chainlink, specifically the BTC/USD data stream available at https://data.chain.link/streams/btc-usd.
Please note that this market is about the price according to Chainlink data stream BTC/USD, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 16, 9PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the BTC/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Spread: Celtics (-1.5)
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for October 15 at 7:30 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Celtics" if the Celtics win the game by 2 or more points.

Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Raptors". If the game ends in a tie, this market will resolve to "Raptors".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: S&P 500 (SPX) Up or Down - October 15
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the official S&P 500 (ticker: SPX) closing price on Wednesday, October 15, 2025 is higher than the official opening price for SPX on the same day.

This market will resolve to "Down" if the official closing price for SPX on that date is lower than the official opening price.

If the official SPX opening price and closing price are exactly equal, this market will resolve 50-50. Note that all figures will be rounded to the nearest cent using standard rounding.

If there is no official opening price for SPX on the specified date (for example, due to a trading halt before market open, system issue, delisting, or other disruption), the market will use the first valid on-exchange trade price of the regular session as the effective opening price.

If there is no official closing price for SPX on the specified date (for example, due to a trading halt into the market close, system issue, delisting, or other disruption), the market will use the last valid on-exchange trade price of the regular session as the effective closing price.

If SPX does not trade at all during the regular session, the market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for this market is S&P 500 Index, specifically the Open and Close values published at https://www.wsj.com/market-data/stocks under "Historical Prices".

question: Spread: Buffalo (-16.5)
description:
In the upcoming college football game, scheduled for October 18 at 2:30 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Buffalo" if Buffalo win the game by 17 or more points.

Otherwise, this market will resolve to "UMass".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Brewers vs. Dodgers
description:
In the upcoming MLB game, scheduled for October 16 at 6:08PM ET:
If the Milwaukee Brewers win, the market will resolve to “Brewers”.
If the Los Angeles Dodgers win, the market will resolve to “Dodgers”.
If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.
If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.
To know when a postponed game will be played, please check the home team's schedule on MLB.com for the listed team and look for the game described as a makeup game.

question: Japan Women's Open: Naomi Osaka vs Jaqueline Cristian
description:
This is a polymarket on the tennis match between Naomi Osaka and Jaqueline Cristian in the Japan Women's Open, scheduled for October 16 at 9:00PM ET.

This market will resolve to 'Osaka' if Naomi Osaka advances against Jaqueline Cristian.

This market will resolve to 'Cristian' if Jaqueline Cristian advances against Naomi Osaka.

If the match is canceled (not played at all), ends in a tie, or is delayed beyond 7 days from the scheduled date without a winner determined, this market will resolve to 50-50.

If the match ends in a walkover (player withdraws before the start and the other advances automatically), this market will resolve in favor of the player(s) who officially advances to the next round.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the WTA Tour. A consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Will the highest temperature in New York City be 57°F or below on October 17?
description:
This market will resolve to the temperature range that contains the highest temperature recorded at the LaGuardia Airport Station in degrees Fahrenheit on 17 Oct '25.

The resolution source for this market will be information from Wunderground, specifically the highest temperature recorded for all times on this day by the Forecast for the LaGuardia Airport Station once information is finalized, available here: https://www.wunderground.com/history/daily/us/ny/new-york-city/KLGA.

This market can not resolve to "Yes" until all data for this date has been finalized.

The resolution source for this market measures temperatures to whole degrees Fahrenheit (eg, 21°F). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market.

Any revisions to temperatures recorded after data is finalized for this market's timeframe will not be considered for this market's resolution.

description:

question: KBO Playoff: Hanwha Eagles vs. Samsung Lions
description:
This is a market on the KBO baseball game between Hanwha Eagles and Samsung Lions, scheduled for October 20 at 5:30AM ET.

This market will resolve to "Hanwha Eagles" if the Hanwha Eagles win the game.

This market will resolve to "Samsung Lions" if the Samsung Lions win the game.

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the KBO. A consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down on October 17?
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the "Close" price for the Binance 1 minute candle for BTC/USDT Oct 16 '25 12:00 in the ET timezone (noon) is lower than the final "Close" price for the Oct 17 '25 12:00 ET candle.

This market will resolve to "Down" if the "Close" price for the Binance 1 minute candle for BTC/USDT Oct 16 '25 12:00 in the ET timezone (noon) is higher than the final "Close" price for the Oct 17 '25 12:00 ET candle.

The resolution source for this market is Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT "Close" prices currently available at https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT with "1m" and "Candles" selected on the top bar.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Ningbo Open: Lin Zhu vs Diana Shnaider
description:
This is a polymarket on the tennis match between Lin Zhu and Diana Shnaider in the Ningbo Open, scheduled for October 16 at 10:00PM ET.

This market will resolve to 'Zhu' if Lin Zhu advances against Diana Shnaider.

This market will resolve to 'Shnaider' if Diana Shnaider advances against Lin Zhu.

If the match is canceled (not played at all), ends in a tie, or is delayed beyond 7 days from the scheduled date without a winner determined, this market will resolve to 50-50.

If the match ends in a walkover (player withdraws before the start and the other advances automatically), this market will resolve in favor of the player(s) who officially advances to the next round.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the WTA Tour. A consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: European Open: Lorenzo Musetti vs Yannick Hanfmann
description:
This is a polymarket on the tennis match between Lorenzo Musetti and Yannick Hanfmann in the European Open, scheduled for October 16 at 12:00PM ET.

This market will resolve to 'Musetti' if Lorenzo Musetti advances against Yannick Hanfmann.

This market will resolve to 'Hanfmann' if Yannick Hanfmann advances against Lorenzo Musetti.

If the match is canceled (not played at all), ends in a tie, or is delayed beyond 7 days from the scheduled date without a winner determined, this market will resolve to 50-50.

If the match ends in a walkover (player withdraws before the start and the other advances automatically), this market will resolve in favor of the player(s) who officially advances to the next round.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the ATP Tour. A consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

description:

question: LoL: Bilibili Gaming vs Fnatic (BO1)
description:
This market will resolve to "Bilibili Gaming" if Bilibili Gaming win against Fnatic in the named LoL match.

This market will resolve to "Fnatic" if Fnatic win against Bilibili Gaming in the LoL match.

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.

If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for this market will be official information from liquipedia: https://liquipedia.net/leagueoflegends/Main_Page

question: Bruins vs. Golden Knights: O/U 5.5
description:
In the upcoming NHL game, scheduled for October 16 at 10:00 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Over" if the Bruins and Golden Knights combine to score 6 or more goals in this game.

If the combined total is less than 6, this market will resolve to "Under".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will The New York Times have its Pentagon press pass revoked by December 31 2025?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if it is officially announced that the listed media outlet’s Pentagon press pass is revoked by December 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, "Pentagon press pass" means the OSD Public Affairs–issued Pentagon building access credential (press accreditation) required for routine entry to Pentagon facilities and press workspaces; briefing invites or remote/pool access do not qualify.

A qualifying revocation includes any circumstances under which an outlet is no longer permitted to hold any active Pentagon press badges, whether through rescinding, deactivation, collection, or non-renewal, etc. This includes time-boxed or indefinite suspensions affecting the entire outlet.

If a qualifying announcement is made by December 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "Yes" even if the effective date is later; any later reinstatement will not be considered.

The primary resolution source will be information from the Department of Defense (Pentagon), however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will Fox News have its Pentagon press pass revoked by December 31 2025?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if it is officially announced that the listed media outlet’s Pentagon press pass is revoked by December 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, "Pentagon press pass" means the OSD Public Affairs–issued Pentagon building access credential (press accreditation) required for routine entry to Pentagon facilities and press workspaces; briefing invites or remote/pool access do not qualify.

A qualifying revocation includes any circumstances under which an outlet is no longer permitted to hold any active Pentagon press badges, whether through rescinding, deactivation, collection, or non-renewal, etc. This includes time-boxed or indefinite suspensions affecting the entire outlet.

If a qualifying announcement is made by December 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "Yes" even if the effective date is later; any later reinstatement will not be considered.

The primary resolution source will be information from the Department of Defense (Pentagon), however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Texas State vs. Marshall: O/U 66.5
description:
In the upcoming college football game, scheduled for October 18 at 3:30 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Over" if Texas State and Marshall combine to score 67 or more points in this game.

If the combined total is less than 67, this market will resolve to "Under".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.description:

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the XRP/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/XRP_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance XRP/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Steelers vs. Bengals: O/U 44.5
description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for October 16 at 8:15 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Over" if the Steelers and Bengals combine to score 45 or more points in this game.

If the combined total is less than 45, this market will resolve to "Under".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: Steelers vs. Bengals
events.description:
In the upcoming NFL game, scheduled for October 16 at 8:15PM ET:
If the Pittsburgh Steelers win, the market will resolve to “Steelers”.
If the Cincinnati Bengals win, the market will resolve to “Bengals”.
If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.
If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will Trump say "Job" 10+ times during ballroom dinner on October 15?
description:
Donald Trump is scheduled to host a ballroom dinner on October 15, 2025, at 7:30 PM ET (see https://rollcall.com/factbase/trump/topic/calendar/).

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump says the listed term during his appearance at the specified event. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Pluralization/possessive of the listed term will count toward the resolution of this market.

Instances where the term is used in a compound word will count regardless of context (e.g. joyful is not a compound word for "joy," however "killjoy" is a compounding of the words "kill" and "joy").

If this market requires a specified number of mentions of a person’s first or last name, a full-name mention will count as one mention (e.g., if a market is about “Joe / Biden 5+ times,” a mention of “Joe Biden” will count once).

This market is explicitly about the scheduled event titled "The President hosts a Ballroom Dinner" (https://rollcall.com/factbase/trump/topic/calendar/). Speeches, events, or comments that occur outside of the named, scheduled event will not qualify toward this market's resolution. If the events contain a Q&A, it will count toward the resolution of this market.

If this event is definitively cancelled, or otherwise is not aired by October 15, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be video of the events.

question: Will Tempted win the 2025 TAB Everest?
description:
This market will resolve according to the winner of the 2025 TAB Everest at Randwick Racecourse in Sydney, Australia. 

This market will close on October 18, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, allowing time to account for any disputes or disqualifications that might occur post-race. If the race is permanently cancelled or does not take place by November 18, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "Other".

In the event of a tie between two or more horses, the market will resolve in favor of the horse whose name appears first in alphabetical order.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from The TAB Everest (https://www.theeverest.com.au/), however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the ETH/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the ETH/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/ETH_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance ETH/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Ethereum Up or Down - October 16, 4:00AM-8:00AM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the Ethereum price at the end of the time range specified in the title is greater than or equal to the price at the beginning of that range. Otherwise, it will resolve to "Down".
The resolution source for this market is information from Chainlink, specifically the ETH/USD data stream available at https://data.chain.link/streams/eth-usd.
Please note that this market is about the price according to Chainlink data stream ETH/USD, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Tennessee vs. Alabama: O/U 59.5
description:
In the upcoming college football game, scheduled for October 18 at 7:30 PM ET:

This market will resolve to "Over" if Tennessee and Alabama combine to score 60 or more points in this game.

If the combined total is less than 60, this market will resolve to "Under".

If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed. If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: BNP Paribas Nordic Open: Sebastian Korda vs Casper Ruud
description:
This is a polymarket on the tennis match between Sebastian Korda and Casper Ruud in the BNP Paribas Nordic Open, scheduled for October 17 at 5:00AM ET.

This market will resolve to 'Korda' if Sebastian Korda advances against Casper Ruud.

This market will resolve to 'Ruud' if Casper Ruud advances against Sebastian Korda.

If the match is canceled (not played at all), ends in a tie, or is delayed beyond 7 days from the scheduled date without a winner determined, this market will resolve to 50-50.

If the match ends in a walkover (player withdraws before the start and the other advances automatically), this market will resolve in favor of the player(s) who officially advances to the next round.

The primary resolution source will be official information from the ATP Tour. A consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Bitcoin Up or Down - October 17, 7PM ET
description:
This market will resolve to "Up" if the close price is greater than or equal to the open price for the BTC/USDT 1 hour candle that begins on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "Down".

The resolution source for this market is information from Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT pair (https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT). The close « C » and open « O » displayed at the top of the graph for the relevant "1H" candle will be used once the data for that candle is finalized.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.
